Using Genetics to DeterminePaternityCaroline Efstathion M.S.*Understanding Insecticides and Their Role inAvicultureVector-borne Avian DiseasesMadeleine FrancoThe Family Album: Documenting the FlockDr. Walt Frey*Adventures Studying the Recovery of theRed-vented Cockatoo in the PhilippinesLee GibsonBird Clubs 911Debbie GoodrichRethinking the Controversy: EmpoweringClipped ParrotsBarbara Heidenriech*What Makes an Expert an Expert?Training for Conservation: Kakapo RecoveryA Good Start to a Good Bird—Raising andTraining a Great Companion ParrotSteve Milpacher*The Lory Conservation Network: ConservationThrough CooperationConservation of the Critically Endangered YellowcrestedCockatoo (Cacatua sulphera)Sharman Hoppes, DVM, ABVP (Avian)*Treatment of MegabacteriaAnnette HowardThe Future of Exhibition in the USAHilla Niemann, MSc.*The Power of Keeping Parrots as PetsThe Pitfalls of Parrot TrainingRainer Neimann, Ph.D.With All SensesDr. Cromwell Purchase*Reproductive Research Strategies for the Spix’sMacawsGary & Lynn Redden*Meet Gary & Lynn Redden—The “Golden Macaws”Linda S. RubinA Discussion on the Genetics of the New “GoldenMacaw” MutationChanging Trends and Art of Exhibiting Parrots inthe USARobin ShewokisWorkshop—Enriching Your Birds’ Lives, Parts I & IILynne SingermanSocial Media Marketing Made EasyMark Stafford, DDSWhat’s So Special About Parrots?Patricia Sund*The Chop Revolution: A Method of Feeding YourBirds Without Losing Your MindGenny WallBack to our Roots: Grassroots Legislation* These speakers will be featured on the 2012 ConventionDVDs, available for preorder individually ($15) or as an entireset ($150) at www.afabirds.org.
